news_header: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz and Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi co-chair the 7th Intergovernmental Consultations in New Delhi, focusing on deepening cooperation in various sectors.
news_text: Chancellor Olaf Scholz of Germany and Prime Minister Narendra Modi of India are co-chairing the 7th Intergovernmental Consultations (IGC) in New Delhi. Scholz, on his third visit to India since becoming Chancellor, emphasized the need for increased cooperation between the two nations. The discussions aim to enhance collaboration in defense, economy, and climate, while also addressing a potential free trade agreement between the EU and India. The IGC, lasting two days, reflects the growing strategic partnership between Germany and India, particularly in the Indo-Pacific region. Both leaders expressed optimism about the future of their bilateral relations.
